Dogecoin $DOGE Faces Significant Downturn as Selling Pressure Mounts

https://36crypto.com/dogecoin-faces-significant-downturn-as-selling-pressure-mounts/

$DOGE  dropped 3.6% in the past 24 hours, underperforming the broader crypto market as sellers took control after DOGE lost the $0.137‚Äì$0.140 support zone, a move that triggered stop-losses and pushed price toward $0.134, near late-2024 levels.   Momentum indicators remain weak, with RSI drifting lower at 41 and MACD confirming a bearish crossover, while price sits nearly 44% below the 200-day EMA, highlighting a fragile structure. This weakness is compounded by a risk-off market, rising Bitcoin dominance, and a sharp drop in derivatives activity as volume and open interest fall and funding turns negative, signaling fading speculative appetite.   With liquidity thinning and sentiment still cautious, the near-term bias remains skewed to the downside unless buyers can reclaim lost support ‚Äî will $DOGE  defend this zone and stage a relief bounce, or is a deeper move toward lower historical supports now inevitable? Alright, pay attention here ‚Äî this DOGE move isn‚Äôt random, and the chart is clearly speaking if you slow down and read it.

After a steady sell-off,  $DOGE tapped into a clean demand zone around 0.1326 and immediately showed a strong reaction, printing a sharp bullish candle that signals buyers stepping back in. That rejection from the lows suggests selling pressure is getting exhausted, and the bounce we‚Äôre seeing now is a classic relief move after a controlled pullback. As long as price holds above this demand area, momentum favors a continuation push toward the nearby resistance zone rather than a deeper breakdown.

Right now, the structure supports a short-term bullish bias, but continuation only stays valid if DOGE keeps building above the current base and doesn‚Äôt slip back into the rejection zone.

Outlook:
Holding above support keeps bulls in control; a loss of the base would shift momentum back to sellers.
